questions.question: $$\text{A worker suffers a }20\%\text{ cut in wages.} \text{He regains his original pay by obtaining a rise of:}$$
$$\text{If } m \text{ men can do a job in } d \text{ days,}\newline\text{then the number of days in which } (m+r) \text{ men can do the job is:}$$
$$\text{A boy walks from his home to school at }6\text{ km/h}\newline\text{and returns at }2\text{ km/h. His average speed is:}$$
$$\text{A car travels from } P \text{ to } Q \text{ at }30\text{ km/h}\newline\text{and returns at }40\text{ km/h. Average speed is nearest to:}$$

$$	ext{A man invests Rs. }10{,}000	ext{ for a year.}
ewline	ext{Of this, Rs. }4{,}000	ext{ at }5\%,\; Rs. 3{,}500	ext{ at }4\%.
ewline	ext{The rest at }\alpha\%.
ewline	ext{Total interest is Rs. }500.\;\alpha = ?$$
$$\text{Let }x_1,x_2,\dots,x_{100}\text{ be positive integers}\newline\text{such that }x_i + x_{i+1} = k.\newline\text{If }x_{10}=1,\text{ find }x_1.$$
$$a_0 = 1,\; a_1 = 1,\newline a_n = a_{n-1}a_{n-2} + 1.\newline\text{Then:}$$
$$\text{Two trains of equal length }L\text{ travel at speeds }v_1,v_2.\newline\text{They take }T\text{ seconds to cross each other.}\newline\text{Find }L\text{ in feet. (1 mile = 5280 ft)}$$
$$\text{A salesman sold two pipes for Rs.12 each.}\newline\text{Profit on one = }20\%,\; \text{loss on the other = }20\%.\newline\text{Overall, he:}$$
$$\text{Digit in the units place of }1! + 2! + 3! + \cdots + 99!$$
$$\text{July 3, 1977 was a Sunday.}\newline\text{Then July 3, 1970 was:}$$
$$\text{June 10, 1979 was a Sunday.}\newline\text{Then May 10, 1972 was:}$$
$$\frac{a+b}{b+c} = \frac{c+d}{d+a}.\newline\text{Then:}$$
$$10\%\text{ voters did not vote; 60 blank votes;}\newline\text{winner had 47\% of total voters;}\newline\text{won by 308 votes. Find total voters.}$$

$$\text{A student took 5 papers with marks proportional to }2:3:4:5:6.\newline\text{He obtained }\tfrac{3}{5}\text{ of total full marks.}\newline\text{Number of papers with }{>}50\%\text{ marks is:}$$
$$\text{Two contestants run a 3 km race on a circular track of length }300\text{ m.}\newline\text{Speeds ratio }4:3.\newline\text{How often and where does winner pass the other?}$$

$$a+7b+3c+5d=0
ewline8a+6b+c+2d=-16
ewline2a+5b+4c+8d=-16
ewline5a+3b+7c+d=-16
ewline	ext{Find }(a+d)(b+c).$$
$$x,y\text{ positive integers, }x>y.\newline3x+2y \equiv 2\pmod 5,\; 2x+3y \equiv 3\pmod 5.\newline\text{Find }(x-y)\bmod 5.$$
$$x+y+z=10,\; x,y,z\in\mathbb{Z}^+.\newline\text{Number of solutions?}$$
$$\text{Clock hands observed from 12{:}45 pm onward.}\newline\text{When next will they point in the same direction?}$$
$$\text{Packets contain }A,B,C.\newline5A+3B+7C=24.50,\;2A+3B+3C=17.00.\newline\text{Find cost of }16A+9B+23C.$$
$$\text{Which statement about elements/subsets of }\{1,2,\{1,2,3\}\}\text{ is correct?}$$
$$\text{A simplex: whenever }S\text{ is included, all nonempty subsets of }S\text{ included.}\newline\text{Which collection is a simplex?}$$
options: $$\text{All subsets not containing an even number}$$

questions.question: $$S=\{0, \text{all even integers}\}.\newline\text{Which operations keep }S\text{ closed?}\newline[1]\text{ addition, }[2]\text{ subtraction, }[3]\text{ multiplication, }[4]\text{ division, }[5]\text{ mean}$$
$$\text{If }X,Y,Z\text{ are sets, the set of numbers belonging}\newline\text{to exactly two of }X,Y,Z\text{ is:}$$
$$\text{For sets }P,Q,R,\; s\in(P\triangle Q)\triangle R\newline\text{iff }s\text{ is in:}$$
options: $$\text{at least one of }P,Q,R \text{ but not all three}$$
$$\text{exactly one of }P,Q,R \text{ or in all three}$$
